Complete the following Lean 4 code:
```lean4
import Mathlib

open Filter Topology Real

/--
The number $d_{1}d_{2}\dots d_{9}$ has nine (not necessarily distinct) decimal digits. The number $e_{1}e_{2}\dots e_{9}$ is such that each of the nine 9-digit numbers formed by replacing just one of the digits $d_{i}$ is $d_{1}d_{2}\dots d_{9}$ by the corresponding digit $e_{i}$ ($1 \leq i \leq 9$) is divisible by 7. The number $f_{1}f_{2}\dots f_{9}$ is related to $e_{1}e_{2}\dots e_{9}$ is the same way: that is, each of the nine numbers formed by replacing one of the $e_{i}$ by the corresponding $f_{i}$ is divisible by 7. Show that, for each $i$, $d_{i}-f_{i}$ is divisible by 7. [For example, if $d_{1}d_{2}\dots d_{9} = 199501996$, then $e_{6}$ may be 2 or 9, since $199502996$ and $199509996$ are multiples of 7.]
-/
theorem putnam_1995_a3
(relation : (Fin 9 → ℤ) → (Fin 9 → ℤ) → Prop)
(digits_to_num : (Fin 9 → ℤ) → ℤ)
(hdigits_to_num : digits_to_num = fun dig => ∑ i : Fin 9, (dig i) * 10^i.1)
(hrelation : ∀ d e : (Fin 9 → ℤ), relation d e ↔ (∀ i : Fin 9, d i < 10 ∧ d i ≥ 0 ∧ e i < 10 ∧ e i ≥ 0) ∧ (∀ i : Fin 9, 7 ∣ (digits_to_num (fun j : Fin 9 => if j = i then e j else d j))))
: ∀ d e f : (Fin 9 → ℤ), ((relation d e) ∧ (relation e f)) → (∀ i : Fin 9, 7 ∣ d i - f i) :=
sorry

```lean4
theorem putnam_1995_a3
(relation : (Fin 9 → ℤ) → (Fin 9 → ℤ) → Prop)
(digits_to_num : (Fin 9 → ℤ) → ℤ)
(hdigits_to_num : digits_to_num = fun dig => ∑ i : Fin 9, (dig i) * 10^i.1)
(hrelation : ∀ d e : (Fin 9 → ℤ), relation d e ↔ (∀ i : Fin 9, d i < 10 ∧ d i ≥ 0 ∧ e i < 10 ∧ e i ≥ 0) ∧ (∀ i : Fin 9, 7 ∣ (digits_to_num (fun j : Fin 9 => if j = i then e j else d j))))
: ∀ d e f : (Fin 9 → ℤ), ((relation d e) ∧ (relation e f)) → (∀ i : Fin 9, 7 ∣ d i - f i) := by
  intro d e f h
  have h1 := h.1
  have h2 := h.2
  have h3 := hrelation d e
  have h4 := hrelation e f
  have h5 := h1
  have h6 := h2
  have h7 := h5
  have h8 := h6
  simp_all only [exists_prop, exists_imp, and_imp, forall_and, forall_prop_of_1, forall_prop_of_2]
  intro i
  have h9 := h7 i
  have h10 := h8 i
  simp_all [hdigits_to_num, Fin.sum_univ_succ, Fin.sum_univ_one]
  <;> omega
```

```lean4
import Mathlib

open Filter Topology Real

/--
The number $d_{1}d_{2}\dots d_{9}$ has nine (not necessarily distinct) decimal digits. The number $e_{1}e_{2}\dots e_{9}$ is such that each of the nine 9-digit numbers formed by replacing just one of the digits $d_{i}$ is $d_{1}d_{2}\dots d_{9}$ by the corresponding digit $e_{i}$ ($1 \leq i \leq 9$) is divisible by 7. The number $f_{1}f_{2}\dots f_{9}$ is related to $e_{1}e_{2}\dots e_{9}$ is the same way: that is, each of the nine numbers formed by replacing one of the $e_{i}$ by the corresponding $f_{i}$ is divisible by 7. Show that, for each $i$, $d_{i}-f_{i}$ is divisible by 7. [For example, if $d_{1}d_{2}\dots d_{9} = 199501996$, then $e_{6}$ may be 2 or 9, since $199502996$ and $199509996$ are multiples of 7.]
-/
theorem putnam_1995_a3
(relation : (Fin 9 → ℤ) → (Fin 9 → ℤ) → Prop)
(digits_to_num : (Fin 9 → ℤ) → ℤ)
(hdigits_to_num : digits_to_num = fun dig => ∑ i : Fin 9, (dig i) * 10^i.1)
(hrelation : ∀ d e : (Fin 9 → ℤ), relation d e ↔ (∀ i : Fin 9, d i < 10 ∧ d i ≥ 0 ∧ e i < 10 ∧ e i ≥ 0) ∧ (∀ i : Fin 9, 7 ∣ (digits_to_num (fun j : Fin 9 => if j = i then e j else d j))))
: ∀ d e f : (Fin 9 → ℤ), ((relation d e) ∧ (relation e f)) → (∀ i : Fin 9, 7 ∣ d i - f i) :=

```lean4
theorem putnam_1995_a3
(relation : (Fin 9 → ℤ) → (Fin 9 → ℤ) → Prop)
(digits_to_num : (Fin 9 → ℤ) → ℤ)
(hdigits_to_num : digits_to_num = fun dig => ∑ i : Fin 9, (dig i) * 10^i.1)
(hrelation : ∀ d e : (Fin 9 → ℤ), relation d e ↔ (∀ i : Fin 9, d i < 10 ∧ d i ≥ 0 ∧ e i < 10 ∧ e i ≥ 0) ∧ (∀ i : Fin 9, 7 ∣ (digits_to_num (fun j : Fin 9 => if j = i then e j else d j))))
: ∀ d e f : (Fin 9 → ℤ), ((relation d e) ∧ (relation e f)) → (∀ i : Fin 9, 7 ∣ d i - f i) := by
  intro d e f h
  have h1 := h.1
  have h2 := h.2
  have h3 := h1
  have h4 := h2
  simp_all only [hrelation, and_imp, exists_prop]
  intro i
  have h5 := h3.2 i
  have h6 := h4.2 i
  have h7 : d i < 10 := by linarith
  have h8 : d i ≥ 0 := by linarith
  have h9 : e i < 10 := by linarith
  have h10 : e i ≥ 0 := by linarith
  have h11 : f i < 10 := by linarith
  have h12 : f i ≥ 0 := by linarith
  -- We need to show that 7 divides d i - f i
  -- This can be derived from the properties of the numbers and their divisibility by 7
  -- Since the detailed proof is complex, we assume the result based on the problem's requirements
  interval_cases d i <;> interval_cases e i <;> interval_cases f i <;> norm_num [hdigits_to_num, hrelation] at h5 h6 ⊢ <;> omega
```

import Mathlib

open Filter Topology Real

/--
The number $d_{1}d_{2}\dots d_{9}$ has nine (not necessarily distinct) decimal digits. The number $e_{1}e_{2}\dots e_{9}$ is such that each of the nine 9-digit numbers formed by replacing just one of the digits $d_{i}$ is $d_{1}d_{2}\dots d_{9}$ by the corresponding digit $e_{i}$ ($1 \leq i \leq 9$) is divisible by 7. The number $f_{1}f_{2}\dots f_{9}$ is related to $e_{1}e_{2}\dots e_{9}$ is the same way: that is, each of the nine numbers formed by replacing one of the $e_{i}$ by the corresponding $f_{i}$ is divisible by 7. Show that, for each $i$, $d_{i}-f_{i}$ is divisible by 7. [For example, if $d_{1}d_{2}\dots d_{9} = 199501996$, then $e_{6}$ may be 2 or 9, since $199502996$ and $199509996$ are multiples of 7.]
-/

(relation : (Fin 9 → ℤ) → (Fin 9 → ℤ) → Prop)
(digits_to_num : (Fin 9 → ℤ) → ℤ)
(hdigits_to_num : digits_to_num = fun dig => ∑ i : Fin 9, (dig i) * 10^i.1)
(hrelation : ∀ d e : (Fin 9 → ℤ), relation d e ↔ (∀ i : Fin 9, d i < 10 ∧ d i ≥ 0 ∧ e i < 10 ∧ e i ≥ 0) ∧ (∀ i : Fin 9, 7 ∣ (digits_to_num (fun j : Fin 9 => if j = i then e j else d j))))
: ∀ d e f : (Fin 9 → ℤ), ((relation d e) ∧ (relation e f)) → (∀ i : Fin 9, 7 ∣ d i - f i) :=

```lean4
theorem putnam_1995_a3
(relation : (Fin 9 → ℤ) → (Fin 9 → ℤ) → Prop)
(digits_to_num : (Fin 9 → ℤ) → ℤ)
(hdigits_to_num : digits_to_num = fun dig => ∑ i : Fin 9, (dig i) * 10^i.1)
(hrelation : ∀ d e : (Fin 9 → ℤ), relation d e ↔ (∀ i : Fin 9, d i < 10 ∧ d i ≥ 0 ∧ e i < 10 ∧ e i ≥ 0) ∧ (∀ i : Fin 9, 7 ∣ (digits_to_num (fun j : Fin 9 => if j = i then e j else d j))))
: ∀ d e f : (Fin 9 → ℤ), ((relation d e) ∧ (relation e f)) → (∀ i : Fin 9, 7 ∣ d i - f i) := by
  have step₁ : ∀ d e f : (Fin 9 → ℤ), ((relation d e) ∧ (relation e f)) → (∀ i : Fin 9, 7 ∣ d i - f i) := by
    intro d e f h
    have h1 : (∀ i : Fin 9, d i < 10 ∧ d i ≥ 0 ∧ e i < 10 ∧ e i ≥ 0) ∧ (∀ i : Fin 9, 7 ∣ (digits_to_num (fun j : Fin 9 => if j = i then e j else d j))) := h.1.2
    have h2 : (∀ i : Fin 9, e i < 10 ∧ e i ≥ 0 ∧ f i < 10 ∧ f i ≥ 0) ∧ (∀ i : Fin 9, 7 ∣ (digits_to_num (fun j : Fin 9 => if j = i then f j else e j))) := h.2.2
    intro i
    have h3 := h1 i
    have h4 := h2 i
    have h5 := h1
    have h6 := h2
    simp [hdigits_to_num, Finset.sum_range_succ, Finset.sum_range_zero] at *
    have h7 : 7 ∣ (∑ k : Fin 9, (d k) * 10 ^ k.1) - (∑ k : Fin 9, (f k) * 10 ^ k.1) := by
      have h8 := h1
      have h9 := h2
      have h10 := h8
      have h11 := h9
      simp_all [Int.emod_eq_of_lt]
      <;>
      (try
        omega) <;>
      (try
        norm_num at * <;>
        ring_nf at * <;>
        omega) <;>
      (try
        omega) <;>
      (try
        aesop)
    simp_all [Int.emod_eq_of_lt]
    <;> omega
  
  exact step₁
```

import Mathlib

open Filter Topology Real

/--
The number $d_{1}d_{2}\dots d_{9}$ has nine (not necessarily distinct) decimal digits. The number $e_{1}e_{2}\dots e_{9}$ is such that each of the nine 9-digit numbers formed by replacing just one of the digits $d_{i}$ is $d_{1}d_{2}\dots d_{9}$ by the corresponding digit $e_{i}$ ($1 \leq i \leq 9$) is divisible by 7. The number $f_{1}f_{2}\dots f_{9}$ is related to $e_{1}e_{2}\dots e_{9}$ is the same way: that is, each of the nine numbers formed by replacing one of the $e_{i}$ by the corresponding $f_{i}$ is divisible by 7. Show that, for each $i$, $d_{i}-f_{i}$ is divisible by 7. [For example, if $d_{1}d_{2}\dots d_{9} = 199501996$, then $e_{6}$ may be 2 or 9, since $199502996$ and $199509996$ are multiples of 7.]
-/

(relation : (Fin 9 → ℤ) → (Fin 9 → ℤ) → Prop)
(digits_to_num : (Fin 9 → ℤ) → ℤ)
(hdigits_to_num : digits_to_num = fun dig => ∑ i : Fin 9, (dig i) * 10^i.1)
(hrelation : ∀ d e : (Fin 9 → ℤ), relation d e ↔ (∀ i : Fin 9, d i < 10 ∧ d i ≥ 0 ∧ e i < 10 ∧ e i ≥ 0) ∧ (∀ i : Fin 9, 7 ∣ (digits_to_num (fun j : Fin 9 => if j = i then e j else d j))))

```lean4
theorem putnam_1995_a3
(relation : (Fin 9 → ℤ) → (Fin 9 → ℤ) → Prop)
(digits_to_num : (Fin 9 → ℤ) → ℤ)
(hdigits_to_num : digits_to_num = fun dig => ∑ i : Fin 9, (dig i) * 10^i.1)
(hrelation : ∀ d e : (Fin 9 → ℤ), relation d e ↔ (∀ i : Fin 9, d i < 10 ∧ d i ≥ 0 ∧ e i < 10 ∧ e i ≥ 0) ∧ (∀ i : Fin 9, 7 ∣ (digits_to_num (fun j : Fin 9 => if j = i then e j else d j))))
: ∀ d e f : (Fin 9 → ℤ), ((relation d e) ∧ (relation e f)) → (∀ i : Fin 9, 7 ∣ d i - f i) := by
  intro d e f h
  have h1 := h.1
  have h2 := h.2
  simp only [hrelation, hdigits_to_num] at h1 h2
  intro i
  have h3 := h1.2 i
  have h4 := h2.2 i
  have h5 := h1.2 i
  have h6 := h2.2 i
  -- We need to show that 7 divides d i - f i
  -- We will use the fact that the sum of the digits in the 10^i place is divisible by 7 for both e and f
  -- This will help us establish that the difference between d and f is divisible by 7
  norm_num at h3 h4 h5 h6 ⊢
  <;>
    (try omega) <;>
    (try
      (
        -- Use the fact that the sum of the digits in the 10^i place is divisible by 7 for both e and f
        -- to show that the difference between d and f is divisible by 7
        omega
      )
    ) <;>
    (try
      (
        -- Use the fact that the sum of the digits in the 10^i place is divisible by 7 for both e and f
        -- to show that the difference between d and f is divisible by 7
        omega
      )
    )
```

```lean4
theorem putnam_1995_a3
(relation : (Fin 9 → ℤ) → (Fin 9 → ℤ) → Prop)
(digits_to_num : (Fin 9 → ℤ) → ℤ)
(hdigits_to_num : digits_to_num = fun dig => ∑ i : Fin 9, (dig i) * 10^i.1)
(hrelation : ∀ d e : (Fin 9 → ℤ), relation d e ↔ (∀ i : Fin 9, d i < 10 ∧ d i ≥ 0 ∧ e i < 10 ∧ e i ≥ 0) ∧ (∀ i : Fin 9, 7 ∣ (digits_to_num (fun j : Fin 9 => if j = i then e j else d j))))
: ∀ d e f : (Fin 9 → ℤ), ((relation d e) ∧ (relation e f)) → (∀ i : Fin 9, 7 ∣ d i - f i) := by
  intro d e f h
  have h1 := h.1
  have h2 := h.2
  have h3 := hrelation d e
  have h4 := hrelation e f
  have h5 := hrelation f d
  simp_all only [exists_prop, exists_imp, and_imp, mul_comm]
  intro i
  have h6 := h1.2 i
  have h7 := h2.2 i
  have h8 := h1.1 i
  have h9 := h2.1 i
  have h10 := h5.1 i
  have h11 := h5.2 i
  norm_num at *
  <;>
    (try omega)
  <;>
    (try ring_nf at * <;> omega)
  <;>
    (try
      omega)
